content: up the yoke sizes i-l only you will now work a series of increases in preparation for the chart to do so you will need to change to your 4 5 mm us 7 needle with a 40-cm 16-in cord these increases are worked as follows 9 size i slip bor marker *knit 27 m1l* 4 times +4 stitches size j slip bor marker *knit 14 m1l* 8 times +8 stitches size k slip bor marker *knit 6 m1l* 6 times *knit 7 m1l* 6 times *knit 6 m1l* 6 times +18 stitches size l slip bor marker *knit 4 m1l* 2 times *knit 5 m1l* 20 times *knit 4 m1l* 2 times +24 stitches you have increased a total of 4 8 18 24 stitches and now have a total of 112 120 132 140 stitches begin the chart all sizes to reiterate you now have a total of 76 80 84 88 92 96 100 104 112 120 132 140 stitches if you have not done so already you should now change to a 4 5 mm us 7 circular needle with a 40-cm 16-in cord you will now join your cc yarn and begin to follow the stranded colourwork pattern in chart 1 the charted pattern repeat is the same for all sizes but the number of repeats varies chart 1 10 again please keep in mind that working stranded colourwork can affect your gauge check your swatches and go up or down to a 5-mm us 8 or 4-mm us 6 needle or to the needle size you need to achieve the correct gauge you will work the charted pattern repeat 38 40 42 44 46 48 50 52 56 60 66 70 times each round there are 5 increase rounds in the chart and you will increase a total of 38 40 42 44 46 48 50 52 56 60 66 70 stitches in each increase round as the number of stitches in each round increases you will need to change to a circular needle with a longer cord i recommend having cords measuring 60 80 and 100 cm 24 in 32 in 40 in on hand for a comfortable knitting experience note to avoid jogs in the pattern at the bor i recommend slipping the first stitch of the round purlwise with the yarn held in the back on rounds 12 14 17 19 24 29 34 37 40 and 44 at the end of the chart you will have increased a total of 190 200 210 220 230 240 250 260 280 300 330 350 stitches and you now have a total of 266 280 294 308 322 336 350 364 392 420 462 490 stitches you can now break your cc yarn short row you will now work a series of german short row to add shape to the yoke these are optional but i strongly recommend that you do work them you may find it helpful to use clip-on stitch markers
